metadata.title: Indonesia Tax Audit Procedures & Risk Assessment 2025
metadata.source: PMK 15/2025, DJP guidelines, tax consultant insights

pmk15_2025.name: PMK 15/2025 on Tax Audit
pmk15_2025.description: New audit framework introducing significant changes to tax audit procedures
keyChanges: Introduces 3 types of audits (comprehensive, focused, specific)
Shortened response period to 5 working days (from 7 days)

comprehensive.name: Comprehensive Audit
comprehensive.description: Full-scope examination of all items in tax returns

focused.name: Focused Audit
focused.description: Deep dive into one or several specific items

specific.name: Specific Audit
specific.description: Simplified audit on targeted items or obligations
triggerFactors: Data discrepancies (tax return vs third-party reports)

critical.mitigation: Ensure 100% documentation accuracy, reconcile all input VAT

critical.trigger: Input VAT > Output VAT for 3+ consecutive months
critical.mitigation: Validate all input VAT invoices, maintain e-Faktur accuracy

critical.flag: Annual income tax declaration in loss state
critical.mitigation: Document extraordinary expenses, industry benchmarks, business challenges

high.trigger: Related party transactions > 30% revenue, no TP documentation
high.mitigation: Prepare Local File annually, keep management fees < 5% revenue

high.flag: Change of accounting year/method or asset revaluation
high.mitigation: Obtain DJP approval BEFORE implementing changes

high.flag: Non-submission of tax return after risk analysis
high.mitigation: File SPT on time, even if nil report

medium.flag: Tax returns do not meet DJP requirements
medium.mitigation: Use DJP e-Filing system, validate before submission

medium.flag: Profit margin significantly below industry average
medium.mitigation: Document competitive pressures, pricing strategy, one-time expenses
Limit entertainment, classify as business meals where possible

low.trigger: LKPM data does not match tax returns
low.mitigation: Reconcile LKPM with tax reports quarterly

low.trigger: BPJS employees do not match payroll
low.mitigation: Ensure all employees registered in BPJS

notificationPhase.action: DJP sends audit notification letter (Surat Pemberitahuan Pemeriksaan)

openingMeeting.action: Initial meeting between auditors and taxpayer

documentReview.action: Auditors review documents and conduct interviews
taxpayerAction: Respond to document requests within 5 working days (NEW: shortened from 7 days)
documentReview.critical: Response period shortened to 5 working days (PMK 15/2025), no extension available

auditFindings.action: DJP issues audit findings letter (Surat Pemberitahuan Hasil Pemeriksaan - SPHP)

closingMeeting.action: Final meeting to discuss findings and taxpayer rebuttal

assessmentLetter.action: DJP issues tax assessment letter (Surat Ketetapan Pajak - SKP)
taxpayerAction: Pay additional tax within 1 month (or appeal)

coretaxIntegration.description: PMK 15/2025 emphasizes Coretax system and electronic document exchange
requirements: All audit documents must be exchanged via Coretax portal
Electronic seals required for all official documents

riskCriteria: Third-party data mismatches (e.g., bank reports, customs data)

entertainmentExpenses.issue: Entertainment expenses not fully deductible (50% limit)

transferPricingAdjustments.issue: Related party transactions not at arm's length

vatInputCreditDisallowance.issue: Input VAT credit for blocked items (entertainment, luxury cars)

example.calc: 11M input VAT credit denied = 11M additional VAT payable

depreciation.issue: Accelerated depreciation not approved by DJP

taxEvasion.appliesTo: Willful tax evasion (fake invoices, hidden income)

preAudit: Conduct internal audit annually (identify issues before DJP does)
Prepare TP documentation contemporaneously (don't wait for audit)
Reconcile LKPM with tax returns quarterly
duringAudit: Provide complete documents (partial submission raises suspicion)
Be cooperative but not overly volunteering information
Designate single point of contact (avoid conflicting explanations)
Document all interactions (meetings, emails, document requests)
Engage tax consultant if complex issues arise
postAudit: Pay additional tax promptly (stop interest accumulation)
Consider APA if transfer pricing issues recurring

forClients: PMK 15/2025: Response period shortened to 5 days (vs 7 days before) - CRITICAL!
Coretax system mandatory: Ensure digital readiness (authorization, digital signature)
Risk-based selection: Tax refund applications = 95% audit probability
Transfer pricing: Maintain Local File annually (50% penalty if inadequate)
VAT input credit: Entertainment 100% blocked - major audit adjustment
LKPM consistency: Reconcile with tax returns quarterly (avoid specific audit)
riskReduction: Profit margin > 50% of industry benchmark (avoid red flag)
File SPT on time even if nil (avoid non-filing audit)
Prepare rebuttal letter within 5 days (NO extension!)

auditSupport.baliZeroService: Tax audit support IDR 10,000,000 - 50,000,000 (depends on audit type)
auditSupport.timeline: Contact Bali Zero immediately upon receiving audit notification (7-day lead time critical)

quickReference.auditTypes: Comprehensive (5 months), Focused (3 months), Specific (1 month)
